title: Vertical tangents from implicit derivative w/graph

content.description: The graph of the equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>cos</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4224@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is shown above for <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>11</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A3D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. It is known that <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo><mfrac> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>1</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>sin</mi><mi>y</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4379@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. The x-coordinate of point P shown on the graph is 2.
content.question: For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>11</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A3D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, find the y-coordinate of each point on the graph where the line tangent to the graph at that point is vertical.

frqParts.text: For <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>11</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3A3D@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, find the y-coordinate of each point on the graph where the line tangent to the graph at that point is vertical.

topic.text: 2.4: Connecting Differentiability and Continuity - Determining When Derivatives Do and Do Not Exist

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
